Overview

How Youâ€™ll Make an Impact

At Epsilon, we act with integrity, work together to win, and innovate with purpose. In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with sales teams and stakeholders, bridge the gap between business and technology, and make a measurable impact on our companyâ€™s success. If you are passionate about data science, geospatial analytics, and solving complex business challenges, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Audience Lab team, reporting to our Data Science Lead. At Epsilon, you will play a key role in transforming business requirements into scalable technical solutions within our Big Data ecosystem. You will work cross-functionally with Technology and Customer Success Managers to address business needs and deliver high-quality results. Your work will directly contribute to custom audience generation, insights development, and reporting, helping our clients achieve their goals.

What Youâ€™ll Achieve

Use your expertise to research and recommend approaches to solving our technology and business problems.
Generate custom audiences, insights, and reports by leveraging multiple data sources.
Design and develop processes that help monitor and maintain data quality.
Collaborate with Customer Success and Technology teams to translate business needs into actionable technical deliverables.
Develop dashboards with Metabase, Power BI to deliver routine reports to clients and internal stakeholders. These dashboards will provide insights to program performance, business impact and activity monitoring to identify and address execution errors.
Propose analytical solutions based on business needs and understanding.
Identify data sources relevant to business needs.
Communicate findings and solutions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Develop and implement Data Services processes that support scalable data-driven solutions.
Build and optimize machine learning models to drive business insights and decision-making.
Continuously explore and adopt new technologies to improve efficiency and innovation.

Who You Are

What youâ€™ll bring with you:
4+ years of experience with SQL and Python.
2+ years of experience working with AWS and PySpark.
Experience in dashboard development (Metabase preferred).
Proficiency in Data Science, including machine learning model training and spatial data transformation.
Hands-on experience with geospatial data processing and analysis.
Strong knowledge of Big Data technologies and frameworks.
Experience with version control systems, particularly GitHub.
Passion for learning new technologies and solving complex data challenges.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally with sales, technology, and customer success teams.
Experience in presenting and communicating insights to executives and stakeholders.
Why you might stand out from other talent:
Experience with cloud-based data pipelines and automation.
Familiarity with business intelligence tools beyond Metabase.
Strong background in statistical analysis and predictive modeling.
Experience working with high-volume datasets in a production environment.
Additional Information

When You Join Us, Weâ€™ll Create Something EPIC Together

Epsilon is a global data, technology and services company that powers the marketing and advertising ecosystem. For decades, weâ€™ve provided marketers from the worldâ€™s leading brands the data, technology and services they need to engage consumers with 1 View, 1 Vision and 1 Voice. 1 View of their universe of potential buyers. 1 Vision for engaging each individual. And 1 Voice to harmonize engagement across paid, owned and earned channels.

Epsilonâ€™s comprehensive portfolio of capabilities across our suite of digital media, messaging and loyalty solutions bridge the divide between marketing and advertising technology. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each day using advanced AI and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Epsilon is a global company with more than 9,000 employees around the world.

Epsilon Has a Core Set Of 5 Values That Define Our Culture And Guide Us To Create Value For Our Clients, Our People And Consumers. We Are Seeking Candidates That Align With Our Company Values, Demonstrate Them And Make Them Meaningful In Their Day-to-day Work

Act with integrity. We are transparent and have the courage to do the right thing.
Work together to win together. We believe collaboration is the catalyst that unlocks our full potential.
Innovate with purpose. We shape the market with big ideas that drive big outcomes.
Respect all voices. We embrace differences and foster a culture of connection and belonging.
Empower with accountability. We trust each other to own and deliver on common goals.

Because You Matter

Benefits

As an Epsilon employee, you deserve perks and benefits that put you, your family and your finances first. Our benefits encompass a wide range of offerings, including but not limited to the following:

Time to Recharge: 15 days of holidays, LATAM rest week at the end of the year, flex-Fridays (working until noon every other week)
Family Well-Being: Parental/new child benefits
Extra Perks: Hybrid work scheme, medical insurance, language training (English and/or Portuguese), professional development, employee recognition, health awareness benefits, home internet fee.

Title: IT System Analyst / Application Engineer
Location: Argentina (remote)

Role Summary
Seeking an IT System Analyst / Application Engineer to support, enhance, and maintain enterprise applications within its IT ecosystem. The candidate will work closely with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external vendors to ensure seamless system operations, integration, and performance optimization. This role requires a mix of business analysis, system support, and application engineering skills, with a strong understanding of IT infrastructure and software development life cycles.

Key Responsibilities
âœ… System Analysis & Business Support:
Collaborate with business users to gather and define system requirements.
Conduct system analysis to identify gaps, inefficiencies, and areas for process optimization.
Maintain documentation of system functionality, configurations, and updates.
âœ… Application Engineering & Maintenance:
Support and maintain enterprise applications used in finance, operations, or upstream/downstream business units.
Troubleshoot application performance issues and implement fixes.
Work on system enhancements, patches, and upgrades, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.
Implement integration solutions with existing IT systems and third-party applications.
âœ… Data Management & Reporting:
Develop and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database structures.
Utilize Power BI, Power Automate, or other tools to create reports and automate workflows.
Ensure data integrity and security compliance in accordance with IT policies.
âœ… Agile & Project Coordination:
Participate in Agile ceremonies such as backlog grooming, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
Support project planning, stakeholder meetings, and requirement prioritization.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams (developers, QA, business users) for project execution.
âœ… Technical Tool Proficiency:
Work with Microsoft Teams, MS Project, Azure DevOps, and ServiceNow for project tracking and collaboration.
Assist in setting up CI/CD pipelines and DevOps processes where applicable.
Support cloud-based application deployments and optimizations (Azure, AWS).

Required Qualifications & Skills
ðŸ”¹ Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
5+ years of experience in IT system analysis, application engineering, or business systems support.
Experience working in Oil & Gas, Finance, or Enterprise IT environments is preferred.

ðŸ”¹ Technical Skills:
Hands-on experience with enterprise applications, databases (SQL, Oracle, SAP, or similar).
Strong knowledge of Power BI, Power Automate, MS Project, and Agile methodologies.
Familiarity with ITSM tools such as ServiceNow.
Understanding of cloud-based systems (Azure, AWS) and integrations.

ðŸ”¹ Soft Skills & Mindset:
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication skills with business and technical stakeholders.
Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work in fast-paced, cross-functional teams within an Agile framework.

Acerca del empleo
The AI Tutor role is a remote, full-time, temporary position that will last up to 6 months in duration. 
Responsibilities:
Use proprietary software applications to provide input/labels on defined projects.
Support and ensure the delivery of high-quality curated data.
Play a pivotal role in supporting and contributing to the training of new tasks, working closely with the technical staff to ensure the successful development and implementation of cutting-edge initiatives/technologies.
Interact with the technical staff to help improve the design of efficient annotation tools.
Engage in diverse writing assignments to refine generative AI models.
Key Qualifications:
Proficiency in reading and writing, both in informal and professional English.
Strong research skills, and the ability to navigate various information resources, databases, and online resources are essential.
You display outstanding communication, interpersonal, analytical, and organizational capabilities.
Solid reading comprehension skills combined with capacity to exercise autonomous judgment even when presented with limited data/material.
You have a strong passion for and commitment to technological advancements and innovation.
Preferred Qualifications:
In addition to English, you have proficiency in reading and writing in Korean, Vietnamese, Chinese, German, Russian, Italian, French, Arabic, Indonesian, Turkish, Hindi, Persian, Spanish, and/or Portuguese
You possess experience in technical writing, journalism, or a professional writing setting.
Location, Hourly, and Other Expectations:
This position is fully remote.
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship.
If you are based in the US, please note we are unable to hire in the states of Wyoming and Illinois at this time.
Team members are expected to work from 9:00 am - 5:30 pm PST for the first two weeks of training and 9:00am - 5:30pm in their own timezone thereafter.
For those who will be working from a personal device, please note your computer must be capable of running Windows 10 or macOS BigSur 11.0 or later.
Compensation and Benefits:
The pay for this role may range from $35/hour - $65/hr and, for full-time roles, benefits will include medical insurance depending on your country of residence.
Your actual pay will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.

Acerca del empleo
Seeking to hire a Contractor based out of Argentina or Mexico for our Director of Data & Site Analytics Engineering Services.

Scope Of Services

Own product analytics strategy and execution.
Scale a small but mighty team that will provide the right strategic insights to encourage growth and retention of users.
Build process for ensuring that data is available to business leaders and can inform strategic decisions.
Develop the goals, metrics, timeline and communication plan to support the achievement of our analytics goals. 
Partner internally and actively seek out feedback and diverse perspectives to inform your strategy and goals.
Interface directly with the executive team to unlock insights into our users and our business. 
In addition to analytics, you will own the business intelligence reporting environment in Tableau and our event based self-serve analytics tool (Heap).
Ensure accurate reporting and data availability for structured data sets as well as internal self-service. 
Beyond the data analytics team, you will also provide oversight to the website team that directly owns the CMS that backs our marketing website along with analytics support for our web properties.

Why Youâ€™re a Great Fit

10+ years experience in Data Analytics 
2+ years leading product analytics, business intelligence teams, while having experience working with data warehousing/engineering teams.
Advanced in your statistics, SQL technical skills, can write and support others with their SQL code skills.
You are an executor as well as a leader; not scared to jump into the details to help drive projects forward.
Experience as an exceptional mentor and thrive when you can support the development of your team.
Experience working with diverse groups of stakeholders and teams and can facilitate productive meetings to achieve shared goals.
Strong ability to translate data into actionable insights and use your experience to elevate the team around you.
Must have direct experience with Tableau, and have experience with product analytics platforms like Heap, Pendo, and/or others.

The team members are largely Spanish or Brazilian Portuguese speakers, our preference would be for a candidate that speaks one or both languages fluently in addition to English.

Please note that given the nature of the contract, this role will not be eligible to participate in company-sponsored benefits.
